Floating-Rate Note Yields
The values of floating rate notes (FRNs) are more stable than those of fixed-rate debt
of similar maturity because the coupon interest rates are reset periodically based on a
reference rate. Recall that the coupon rate on a floating-rate note is the reference rate
plus or minus a margin based on the credit risk of the bond relative to the credit risk
